lib.SignalMath

Class MedianFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.SignalMath.MedianFilter

  • public class MedianFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which defines a simple median filter. After initialization, the "filter()" method can simply be called with the newest input, and the most recent filtered output will be returned. Median filters are useful for rejecting noise which induces large errors for single loops ("shot noise")

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MedianFilter(int length, double init_val)
      Initialize all things needed for the median filter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double filter(double input)
      Add a new input to the filter and get the current output from the filter

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MedianFilter

        public MedianFilter(int length,
                    double init_val)
        Initialize all things needed for the median filter.
        Parameters:
        length - Number of previous values to consider for the median calculation. 5 is probably a good starting point. Bigger length means more noise rejection, but also induces more delay from input to output. Also, median calculations are non-linear in big-O time complexity, so cranking this number up will really start to slow things down.
        init_val - Initial output of the filter. Usually zero, unless you know something about your system that we don't.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public double filter(double input)
        Add a new input to the filter and get the current output from the filter
        Parameters:
        input - - new value to add to the filter
        Returns:
        the present output filtered value
